article_title: Vermont official: Keep health insurer solvent
article_text:
The Vermont Department of Financial Regulation earlier refused to issue a license to PPACA CO-OP organizers.

Concerns about the well-being of Vermont's largest health insurer, Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Vermont, may be creating a gap between the state's insurance regulators and a separate health rate review panel.

Vermont requires insurers to sell all individual and small-group plans through its state-based health insurance exchange, Vermont Health Connect.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Allison Bell
article_metadata.description: Cynthia Stuart warns rate reviewers against taking Vermont Blue's stability for granted.

article_summary:
Vermont requires insurers to sell all individual and small-group plans through its state-based health insurance exchange, Vermont Health Connect.
Concerns about the well-being of Vermont's largest health insurer, Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Vermont, may be creating a gap between the state's insurance regulators and a separate health rate review panel.
The Vermont Department of Financial Regulation earlier refused to issue a license to PPACA CO-OP organizers.
